p: In this study, ethyl acetate was the most effective solvent for extracting a broad variety of compounds from L. pubescens, and its extract possessed strong antibacterial activity against Escherichia coli (KF 918342), Staphylococcus haemolyticus (KCTC 3341), Aeromonas hydrophila (KCTC 12487), Escherichia coli (ATCC 35150), Cronobacter sakazakii (ATCC 29544), and Aeromonas salmonicida (KACC 15136). In particular, the leaves exhibited the strongest antimicrobial activity against these bacteria among the different plant parts tested. Therefore, this study suggests that L. pubescens could be considered a good source for human health.
